[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: MigrationFlag] [Dummy field bypass] The MigrationFlag contains only a dummy bool field - can this 1-byte struct be exploited to bypass migration checks by setting dummy=true when migration should be prevented? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: MigrationFlag] [Default semantics] MigrationFlag derives Default with dummy=false - can attackers exploit default initialization to enable unauthorized migrations before explicit flag setting? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: MigrationFlag] [Multiple instantiation] Can multiple MigrationFlag instances be created under the same account, allowing attacker to selectively choose which flag to check and bypass migration restrictions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/fungible_store.rs] [Struct: MigrationFlag] [Arbitrary derive] MigrationFlag implements Arbitrary for fuzzing - are there edge cases in the dummy bool generation that could expose migration vulnerabilities? (Low)
